subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Landon Donovan was named the U.S. Soccer player of the year in a landslide vote, becoming the first four-time winner. Donovan, 25, also received the award in 2002, when he became the youngest winner, and in 2003 and in 2004. Donovan, who has nine goals to lead the national team this year, received 413 points in voting by a panel of 203 journalists. Goalkeeper Tim Howard was second (122), and the three-time finalist Carlos Bocanegra was third (105).
